content.text:
# Online Film Critics Society Awards 2014

The 18th Online Film Critics Society, honoring the best in film for 2014, were announced on December 8, 2014. The winners were announced on December 15, 2014.
Nominees
{| class="wikitable"
|-
! style="background:#EEDD82; width: 50%" | Best Picture
! style="background:#EEDD82; width: 50%" | Best Director
|-
| valign="top" |
* The Grand Budapest Hotel
* Boyhood
* Ida
* The Lego Movie
* Mommy
* Nightcrawler
* Selma
* Two Days, One Night
* Whiplash
* Under the Skin
| valign="top" |
* 'Richard Linklater – Boyhood'
* Wes Anderson – The Grand Budapest Hotel
* Jean-Pierre Dardenne and Luc Dardenne – Two Days, One Night
* Ava DuVernay – Selma
* Jonathan Glazer – Under the Skin
|-
! style="background:#EEDD82; width: 50%" | Best Actor
! style="background:#EEDD82; width: 50%" | Best Actress
|-
| valign="top" |
* 'Michael Keaton – Birdman'
* Ralph Fiennes – The Grand Budapest Hotel
* Brendan Gleeson – Calvary
* Jake Gyllenhaal – Nightcrawler
* Timothy Spall – Mr. Turner
| valign="top" |
* 'Rosamund Pike – Gone Girl'
* Marion Cotillard – Two Days, One Night
* Essie Davis – The Babadook
* Anne Dorval – Mommy
* Julianne Moore – Still Alice
|-
! style="background:#EEDD82; width: 50%" | Best Supporting Actor
! style="background:#EEDD82; width: 50%" | Best Supporting Actress
|-
| valign="top" |
* 'Edward Norton – Birdman'
* Josh Brolin – Inherent Vice
* Ethan Hawke – Boyhood
* Mark Ruffalo – Foxcatcher
* J. K. Simmons – Whiplash
| valign="top" |
* 'Patricia Arquette – Boyhood'
* Jessica Chastain – A Most Violent Year
* Suzanne Clément – Mommy
* Agata Kulesza – Ida
* Tilda Swinton – Snowpiercer
|-
! style="background:#EEDD82; width: 50%" | Best Animated Feature
! style="background:#EEDD82; width: 50%" | Best Film Not in the English Language
|-
| valign="top" |
* The Lego Movie
* Big Hero 6
* The Boxtrolls
* How to Train Your Dragon 2
* The Tale of the Princess Kaguya
| valign="top" |
* Two Days, One Night
* Ida
* The Missing Picture
* Mommy
* The Tale of the Princess Kaguya
|-
! style="background:#EEDD82; width: 50%" | Best Documentary
! style="background:#EEDD82; width: 50%" | Best Non-U.S. Release (non-competitive category)
|-
| valign="top" |
* Life Itself
* Citizenfour
* The Missing Picture
* National Gallery
* The Overnighters
| valign="top" |
* ’71
* 10,000 km
* Entre Nós
* Han Gong-ju
* Hard to Be a God
* The Look of Silence
* The Salt of the Earth
* Timbuktu
* The Tribe
* What We Do in the Shadows
|-
! style="background:#EEDD82; width: 50%" | Best Adapted Screenplay
! style="background:#EEDD82; width: 50%" | Best Original Screenplay
|-
| valign="top" |
* Gone Girl
* Inherent Vice
* Snowpiercer
* Under the Skin
* We Are the Best!
| valign="top" |
* The Grand Budapest Hotel
* Boyhood
* Selma
* Two Days, One Night
* Whiplash
|-
! style="background:#EEDD82; width: 50%" | Best Editing
! style="background:#EEDD82; width: 50%" | Best Cinematography
|-
| valign="top" |
* Birdman
* Boyhood
* Gone Girl
* The Grand Budapest Hotel
* Whiplash
| valign="top" |
* The Grand Budapest Hotel
* Birdman
* Ida
* Mr. Turner
* Under the Skin
